result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 8, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

11:10 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Audreana M Capps in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Audreana M Capps.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Zaleski is heard on all four cases. Requests a plea and sentencing. 
Plea and Sentencing is approved via Zoom.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Jury status hearing on October 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:33 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Audreana M Capps appeared by phone.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Audreana M Capps.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

22CM33, 22CM39, 22CM41, 22CM42, 22CM47

Attorney Zaleski is heard on the status of the cases.  State has made an offer.
Jury status hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Audreana M Capps
Current: 500 Pine Street, c/o West Union Residential Facility, West Union, IA 52175 United States  (Effective: 08-30-2022)
Prior: 1616 S Marquette Road Room 21, Prairie du Chien, WI 53821
Jury status hearing on September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:27 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Audreana M Capps appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

2022CM000047, 2022CM000033, 2022CM000039, 2022CM000041, 2022CM000042 called together 

2022CM000047 - Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  

Atty Zaleski is heard and Def. stands mute, "Not Guilty" plea entered for all the cases. 
Atty Zaleski is heard and requests a bond modification.  
Atty Steiner takes no position. 

Court will change the bond to a $500.00 signature bond.
Jury status hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:24 PM Cases 22CM33, 22CM39, 22CM41 & 22CM42 called together - appearances stated. 
Defendant Audreana M Capps in court.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Audreana M Capps.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Initial appearance on 22CM39, 22CM41 & 22CM42 will be conducted today

as to  22CM39
Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  

as to 22CM41
Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding. 

as to 22CM42
Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding. 

Atty. Zaleski requests a separate date for plea
Atty. Zaleski requests bond modification to provide for "no violent" conduct with CJD
Atty. Steiner states victim needs to follow process and contact Passages

Court - victim must meet with Passages representative before bond condition can be modified
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 10:50 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 1, 2022 at 10:50 am.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel - Attorney Steven Zaleski

11:36 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Audreana M. Capps appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ian Mickelson appeared by video for defendant.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

22GF160, 22CM33, 22CM39, 2CM41 called together 

State is heard on bond. State requests $250.00 cash bond.  

Attorney Mickelson is heard on all four cases.  
Defendant is heard. 
Court is heard on bond and the condition on bond will remain until court receives the letter requested.  

Court orders 22CM33 a $100.00 cash bond. Conditions remain the same. 
Court orders 22GF160 a $100.00 cash bond. Standard Conditions.
Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:55 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Audreana M Capps not in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Three cases pending for defendant...
  
22CM33 - Adjourned Initial Appearance - No appearance by the defendant, Court authorizes a warrant. 
22CM39 - Initial Appearance - No appearance by the defendant, Court authorizes a warrant. 
22CM41 - Initial Appearance - No appearance by the defendant, Court authorizes a warrant. 

State is heard. State requests a warrant in each of these three matters and for defendant to be held for further hearing.
Bail/bond hearing on June 29, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

1:46 PM Defendant Audreana Marie Capps appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause.

State is heard on bond. State requests a $150.00 Cash bond. Defendant shall have no contact with CJD.

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $500.00 signature bond. Defendant shall have no contact with CJD.

Court advises right to an attorney. 

Case concludes at 1:50 pm.
Hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant shall have no contact with CJD.
